←

Projects

I love building tools for the command line. Also, I use (n)vim for all things writing and tmux for managing sessions. All my code is hosted on Github including this website. These are some of the things I’ve worked on in the past, loosely grouped by 3 categories, namely vim plugins, cli tools and others:

Vim Plugins

  • vim-zen: Barebones Vim plugin manager
  • vim-githubinator: Quickly show selected text on Github
  • vimport: Vim plugin to quickly import and drop modules

CLI Utilities

  • goodreadsh: Command line interface for goodreads.com
  • pip-name: Check whether a package name is available on PyPi
  • amizone-cli: Command line interface for amizone.net
  • chromatic: Create monochromatic backgrounds on the terminal

Others

  • py-splice: A Python interface to splice(2) syscall
  • dash: Unix shell written with piping & history recollection
  • githubfs: Read-only virtual file-system for Github using FUSE
  • Vim Tricks: Amazon Alexa skill that helps you learn new vim tricks
  • Chapelle Wisdom: Amazon Alexa skill that helps uplift your mood

Feel free to reach out to say hi or to discuss about a potential project. Also, I’ll be glad to have you submit a pull request to one of the projects above if you think there’s room for improvement, because there always is.
